body:
### Describe the bug

Trying to compile a class with a **method** that both is **inline** and has a **fused type** as an argument fails.

The error you get is:
```
test.c(8051): error C2129: static function 'PyObject *__pyx_f_4test_1C_method(__pyx_obj_4test_C *,double)' declared but not defined
test.c(1325): note: see declaration of '__pyx_f_4test_1C_method'
```

The code that is generated that seems relevant:
```c
struct __pyx_vtabstruct_4test_C {
  PyObject *(*caller)(struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *);
  PyObject *(*__pyx_fuse_0method)(struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *, int);
  PyObject *(*__pyx_fuse_1method)(struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *, double);
};
static struct __pyx_vtabstruct_4test_C *__pyx_vtabptr_4test_C;
static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject *__pyx_f_4test_1C_method(struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *, int);
static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject *__pyx_f_4test_1C_method(struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *, double);

(...)

/* #### Code section: module_declarations ### */
static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject *__pyx_fuse_0__pyx_f_4test_1C_method(CYTHON_UNUSED struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *__pyx_v_self, CYTHON_UNUSED int __pyx_v_val); /* proto*/
static CYTHON_INLINE PyObject *__pyx_fuse_1__pyx_f_4test_1C_method(CYTHON_UNUSED struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *__pyx_v_self, CYTHON_UNUSED double __pyx_v_val); /* proto*/
static PyObject *__pyx_f_4test_1C_caller(struct __pyx_obj_4test_C *__pyx_v_self); /* proto*/
```

Later on, both `__pyx_fuse_X__pyx_f_4test_1C_method` methods are defined but the call does not use the `__pyx_fuse_X` prefix:
```c
__pyx_t_1 = __pyx_f_4test_1C_method(__pyx_v_self, 5);
```


Note: doing the same for a cdef function (not within a class) works correctly because the function without the fuse prefix is not declared.

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
ctypedef fused fused_type:
    int
    double


cdef class C:
    cdef inline method(self, fused_type val):
        pass


    # Fails with error C2129: static function 'PyObject *__pyx_f_4test_1C_method(__pyx_obj_4test_C *,double)' declared but not defined
    cdef caller(self):
        self.method(5)  # Does not compile


# Same code within functions works correctly
cdef inline ok_fun(fused_type val):
    pass


cdef main():
    ok_fun(5)  # OK!
    ok_fun(5.6)  # OK!
```


### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Windows 10

### Python version

3.11.1

### Cython version

3.0.0b2

### Additional context

https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5037 may be related, although the compilation error is different
title: [BUG] inline methods with fused types generate a compiler error
